subject: Vam Pro haptic reactors problem
description_text:
Hi!

I have recently just purchased and received your new VAM Pro haptic motors
for my SIMSONN pedals (As well as the necessary upgrade to the new control
box)

Having finally assembled everything, plugged in, updated firmware, and run
configuration.

However, it seems that the pedals are now suffering from very severe EMI
interference, as the break pedals now passively increase their input
without touching them (despite looking correct in the configuration page).
I have used the pedals for a long time with the older connection box,
without any issues, but now that I have the new box and the installed
haptic motors, this problem is occurring.

It seems I can't find anywhere to ground the box such that it doesn't
recieve this severe EMI.

Any help with this matter would be greatly appreciated.

-- 
Best regards,
Shayan Jalalipour

conversations.body_text: Hi shayan jalalipour,  Please try using nylon screws and washers to isolate the VAM Pro motor on the brake pedal from the metal bracket. Make sure to place the washers between the motor and the bracket, as this can immediately resolve the issue. The test is simple: detach the motor bracket from the pedal, and if the EMI disappears, the cause is confirmed.

Could you please list the specifc skrew and washer sizes/types for me? So
that I can know what to look for at the store.

Thank you very much for your help!

Best,
Shayan

On Tue, Aug 26, 2025, 7:50 PM service@simsonn.com
Hi shayan jalalipour,  Screw specification: Nylon round head screw M4×8mm Washer specification: Nylon washer M4 Quantity: 16 pcs
